message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper discusses methods for training artificial neural networks (ANNs) to learn new tasks without forgetting old ones, which is a common problem in the field of neural networks. The paper proposes a new method for alleviating catastrophic forgetting by adding a context-dependent gating signal, which is a technique commonly used in the field of neural networks. The paper also discusses the use of weight stabilization, which is another common technique used in the field of neural networks. Based on these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of reinforcement-based learning, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the paper discusses the use of natural language processing, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category cs.CL (Computation and Language).
